text:
The 2017 UEFA Super Cup was the 42nd UEFA Super Cup final, an annual football match organised by UEFA and contested by the reigning champions of the two main European club competitions, the UEFA Champions League and the UEFA Europa League. The match featured Spanish side Real Madrid, the title holders and winners of the 2016–17 UEFA Champions League, and English side Manchester United, the winners of the 2016–17 UEFA Europa League. The match was played at the Philip II Arena in Skopje, Macedonia, on 8 August 2017, and was the first UEFA final staged in the country.
Real Madrid won the match 2–1 for their fourth UEFA Super Cup title.
Teams.
While the two teams had never met in the Super Cup, they had met 10 times in the UEFA Champions League; Real Madrid have the advantage in the teams' previous meetings, with four wins, four draws and two losses.
Details.
The Champions League winners were called as the "home" team for administrative purposes.
